titleInfo.title: USA v. Mendoza-Romero et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - Jacobo-Aguayo's motion to continue trial 33 is granted. Trial of this matter is re-scheduled for 8/13/07, before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon and a jury. The time between 6/27/07 and 8/13/07 shall be excluded under the Speedy Trial Act as to defendant Brenda Jacobo-Aguayo. Jury Trial set for 8/13/2007 in Courtroom 3 (Omaha) before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (KBJ)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:07-cr-00140; USA v. Mendoza-Romero et al;

extension.docketText: ORDER - Jacobo-Aguayo's motion to continue trial 33 is granted. Trial of this matter is re-scheduled for 8/13/07, before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon and a jury. The time between 6/27/07 and 8/13/07 shall be excluded under the Speedy Trial Act as to defendant Brenda Jacobo-Aguayo. Jury Trial set for 8/13/2007 in Courtroom 3 (Omaha) before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken. (KBJ)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Mendoza-Romero et al
titleInfo.subTitle: STRICKEN - ORDER - The defendant's oral motion for reimbursement of costs in forma pauperis is granted. The United States Marshal is ordered to arrange and pay for defendant's return noncustodial transportation from Omaha, Nebraska, to Los Angeles, California, following the hearing on 8/29/07, and for lodging and subsistence not to exceed the authorized per diem as to defendant Brenda Jacobo-Aguayo. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. - (2 certified copies to the USM) (KBJ) Modified on 8/29/2007 to reflect that this pleading is stricken pursuant to Strike Order 45(KBJ).

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:07-cr-00140; USA v. Mendoza-Romero et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: STRICKEN - ORDER - The defendant's oral motion for reimbursement of costs in forma pauperis is granted. The United States Marshal is ordered to arrange and pay for defendant's return noncustodial transportation from Omaha, Nebraska, to Los Angeles, California, following the hearing on 8/29/07, and for lodging and subsistence not to exceed the authorized per diem as to defendant Brenda Jacobo-Aguayo. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. - (2 certified copies to the USM) (KBJ) Modified on 8/29/2007 to reflect that this pleading is stricken pursuant to Strike Order 45(KBJ).

titleInfo.title: USA v. Mendoza-Romero et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Roberto Mendoza-Romero. The defendant plead guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is sentenced to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for 57 months; and shall be given credit for time served. Supervised Release of 5 years with special conditions; $100.00 Special Assessment due and payable immediately. Count II of the Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the government as to this defendant only as to defendant Roberto Mendoza-Romero. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. - (4 certified copies to the USM) (KBJ)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:07-cr-00140; USA v. Mendoza-Romero et al;

titleInfo.title: USA v. Mendoza-Romero et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Brenda Jacobo-Aguayo. The defendant plead guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is sentenced to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for 24 months; and shall be given credit for time served. Supervised Release of 3 years with special conditions; $100.00 Special Assessment due and payable immediately. Count II of the Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the government as to this defendant only. The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons as to defendant Brenda Jacobo-Aguayo. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (4 Certified copies to USM)(KBJ)

Supervised Release of 3 years with special conditions; $100.00 Special Assessment due and payable immediately. Count II of the Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the government as to this defendant only. The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons as to defendant Brenda Jacobo-Aguayo. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon.
